title: Leading Unified Communications Solutions Provider CallTower Publishes New Interview for SMB Decision-Makers Featuring Managing Partner of CNSG
text:
CallTower has published a new interview featuring Ali Niroo, Managing Partner of Converged Network Services Group (CNSG). The interview highlights trends and advice for SMB decision-makers on how to successfully choose and leverage enterprise-class, cloud-based unified communications solutions.
South Jordan, Utah
CallTower , a leading nationwide provider of hosted enterprise-class unified communications solutions for growing organizations, announced today that it has published a new interview for SMB decision-makers featuring Ali Niroo, Managing Partner of Converged Network Services Group (CNSG), a premier master agency for connectivity, cloud and cloud enablement.
In the interview, which is available now on the CallTower blog , Mr. Niroo shared valuable insights and strategic advice for SMB decision-makers, including:
According to industry research from Nemertes , cloud telephony is now the preferred purchasing model, with more than 90% of companies using Software as a service (SaaS) applications. Storage and server virtualization has become more appealing in the last 12 months. Sourcing a best of breed solution such as CallTower with responsibility associated to cost and vendors’ capabilities should be the preferred procurement model for today’s growing SMBs. TDM based PRI/analog voice handoff with voice is still preferred, but in today’s environment in a single or multi-site MPLS design, it is easier to pile on voice services. IT/MSP partners who have or are in the process of onboarding their current client base to Office 365 are a natural fit for CallTower’s platform. The SMB is a market space that will always require immediate attention and responsiveness, and CallTower has a uniquely designed program built to compliment the MSP offering, rather than replace them. CallTower has the ability to integrate the E3 and E4 O365 licenses with their Cisco platform, provide Skype for Business as a hosted PBX, leverage Cisco CallManager “CUCM” in the cloud with new phones, flash existing non end of life hardware, and update to the latest version with a plug and play Lync/Skype for Business integration – and all of this flexibility is unparalleled in the industry.
When asked to reflect on some CNCG business wins that leveraged CallTower’s innovative solutions, Mr. Niroo responded: “There have been several, from small businesses looking for a basic hosted PBX telephony solution and no onboarding of bells and whistles, to very complicated Cisco and Microsoft designs. This flexibility to provide so many platforms has been a very attractive proposition for CNSG clients working with CallTower. The clients are diverse, every opportunity is different, and CallTower’s offering provides CNSG with the flexibility of a portfolio of multiple platforms – without being stuck with a single focused offering.”
As noted, the full text of CallTower’s new interview with Ali Niroo, Managing Partner of Converged Network Services Group (CNSG), is available now on the CallTower blog .
